channel.title: Git on Heartysoft Solutions Limited
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Heartysoft Solutions Limited

item.title: Configure P4Merge as Git Mergetool
item.description: I’ve been using p4merge as my mergetool for a while now. Yet, every time I need to configure it, I seem to be doing google searches with lots of different “ways” to do so. This is a handy lookup for the future :) P4merge is now natively supported by Git (as of March, 2014). The latest version available from the p4merge download site automatically adds the binary path to your environment’s PATH.

item.title: Git Ignore Files and Powershell
item.description: Powershell’s cool. The syntax may be opinionated, but having a proper scripting environment in Windows is excellent. Git is cool. If you don’t use git, you’re @£$££!###. Typically, I create .gitignore files from the git bash. The way I do it is: touch .gitignore The main reason for doing this is because Windows Explorer (or File Explorer as it’s known these days) won’t let me create the .gitignore file – “YOU MUST TYPE A FILENAME”.
